isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - CRUISE CONTROL, PTO, HAND THROTTLE SYSTEM - NO SCCS SWITCHES ACTIVE

svcproc.title: NO SCCS SWITCHES ACTIVE
svcproc.para: Note in circuit diagram that the ON/OFF, SET/RESUME (including the remote SET/RESUME) and the remote DISABLE PTO switch are normally open, momentary switches. With the key switch ON, voltage is being applied from ECM terminal 50, but the ECM expects to see an open circuit. With no switch depressed, voltage measured between ECM terminals 39 and 50 is expected to be between 6.2 and 7.1 volts. An OPEN circuit (6.2 to 7.1 volts between terminals 39 and 50) is the signal that the ECM expects to see with no switch depressed.
